sentences.en: He pointed out that the intemperate life style is the patient population sharp increase primary factor.
sentences.cn: 他指出,无节制的生活方式是患者人数剧增的主要因素.

sentences.en: He was immediately led from the arena, and was warmly rebuked for his intemperate haste.
sentences.cn: 他立刻被带出场, 由于他暴烈性子他受到狠狠的训斥.

sentences.en: His intemperate ambition will bring him disastrous failure.
sentences.cn: 他过度的野心会给他带来灾难性的失败.

sentences.en: His intemperate remarks got him into trouble.
sentences.cn: 他言语肆无忌惮,惹出了是非.

sentences.en: Many people felt threatened by Arther's forceful, sometimes intemperate style.
sentences.cn: 很多人都觉得阿瑟的强硬的 、 有时过激的作风咄咄逼人.

sentences.en: The intemperate life style is the patient population sharp increase primary factor.
sentences.cn: 无节制的生活方式是患者人数剧增的主要因素.

sentences.en: The man who has been intemperate so many years in upon his last legs.
sentences.cn: 那人放纵了这么多年,怕是活不了几天了.

sentences.en: The style was hurried, the tone intemperate.
sentences.cn: 匆促的笔调, 放纵的语气.

sentences.en: The tone of the article is intemperate.

trans.tran_cn: 不温和的，过度的，无节制的，放纵的
trans.tran_en: intemperate language or behaviour shows a lack of control, which other people think is unacceptable
